bug.short_desc: When using Flash debug player, the error pop-up freezes firefox until plugin-container.exe is closed.

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Opera/9.80 (Windows NT 6.1; U; fr) Presto/2.7.62 Version/11.01 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
This happens on any website that uses Flash, and did NOT happen with Firefox 3.6.*, and does NOT happen on Opera, which uses the same NPSWF32.DLL plug-in.
I use the debug version of the Flash Player for professional reasons (found here : http://www.adobe.com/support/flashplayer/downloads.html), and when an error dialog popus up from it, it just freezes Firefox. I can't click any button on the dialog, and have to close plugin-container.exe from task manager for firefox to become responsive again. Sometimes I can click the buttons on the error message if I'm fast, but Firefox stops responding just after that, and I still have to close plugin-container in the task manager for it to become responsive again. It seems also that waiting ~20 seconds allows Firefox to detect the plugin has crashed.
Still, this is a bug with FF 4.0, because I developed my own site with the same Flash player, and it had many errors, which I could close without problems; also, Opera doesn't exhibit such a behavior either.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.Install Flash debug player in place of the regular flash player 2.Go to a web page with Flash in it, preferably a flash movie that can trigger an error. (in my example, let the game load, and then start a new game to trigger some error). 3.Firefox freezes until the plug-in container is closed; or the 'crash detection time' is exceeded. Actual Results: Plugin container crash
Expected Results: Ability to discard the error and continue running the Flash content
Hardware acceleration On, ATI Radeon HD 5870, latest drivers.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 581272 ***
